H0.text: who comes after the president if he dies. Secretary of State

H1.text: who comes after the president if he dies. Speaker of the House

H2.text: who comes after the president if he dies. Chief Justice

H3.text: who comes after the president if he dies. vice president

A4.text: the vice president takes over the 'powers and duties' of the presidency in the event of a president's removal, death, resignation, or inability.

A5.text: The vice president is the second-highest ranking office in the executive branch of the U.S. federal government, after the president of the United States, and ranks first in the presidential line of succession.
